headline: Join the Guardian's Global development community
text: Join our community Welcome to the Guardian's Global development site, launched in 2010 to debate key development issues, including the millennium development goals. We host comment from a range of global voices, alongside news, data, interactives, video, galleries, podcasts and resources specifically aimed at people studying development. Join the conversation. We want to hear your views and experiences from wherever you are in the world, whether you're new to development or an experienced professional. From posting comments to contributing to our regular talk points, there are many ways you can get involved. Here's how to get started: Sign up Set up a Guardian account and create your profile. Please check our community page for guidelines on commenting etiquette. Student voices What's the best way to get a job in development? How can I explore more aid data? Once a month we'll be hosting a question and answer session for students. This is your chance to get advice from a development professional and debate the issues that interest you with your peers. Watch out for our student voices series to post your questions and suggest topics. Talk point Which development issues matter to you? Which stories would you like to read more about? Do you have questions for guests contributing to our monthly podcast? The talk point is an open space for our community to connect and share their experiences. Poverty matters Our Poverty Matters email newsletter, published every two weeks, will keep you up to date with the latest news and comment published on the site. Sign up to receive it in your inbox. Stay informed For the latest news and views in development, check out our daily picks on the blogosphere. Get to know our partners in the development network and find out what events are coming up using our development calendar. Follow us Follow @gdndevelopment and the team  @MaeveShearlaw, @ClaireProvost, @LizFordGuardian and @MarkTran  on Twitter, and get involved in the conversation using the #globaldev hashtag. You can also join Guardian Global development on Facebook. Get in touch Maeve Shearlaw, Global development's community co-ordinator, is your main point of contact for any comments or queries about the community. Email Maeve at maeve.shearlaw@theguardian.com. To contact the rest of the team, email development@theguardian.com. Please be aware we receive a high volume of emails so we may not be able to respond immediately.
